solution_line_template: The price of the cheaper pair after the discount was ${original_price_cheaper_pair}/{half_off_divisor} = $<<{original_price_cheaper_pair}/{half_off_divisor}={discounted_cheaper_price}>>{discounted_cheaper_price}

The total price of both pairs of shoes ${discounted_cheaper_price} + ${original_price_expensive_pair} = $<<{discounted_cheaper_price}+{original_price_expensive_pair}={total_price_before_extra_discount}>>{total_price_before_extra_discount}
The price he ends up paying was ${total_price_before_extra_discount} - ${final_discount_amount} = <<{total_price_before_extra_discount}-{final_discount_amount}={final_price_paid}>>{final_price_paid}
